segments.text: I see the boy balancing on that stool, and it makes my stomach drop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is right there, waiting for her share, completely oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t noticed the water yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is soaked, and she’s just standing there, drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will get caught before the stool tips over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is like a slow-motion accident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost feel the tension in the air.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
